title: URL Shortener
description: Lets you create, inspect, and manage goo.gl short URLs

fields.redirect_uri: The callback URL for your application

browsers.description: Top browsers, e.g. "Chrome"; sorted by (descending) click counts. Only present if this data is available.

countries.description: Top countries (expressed as country codes), e.g. "US" or "DE"; sorted by (descending) click counts. Only present if this data is available.

longUrlClicks.description: Number of clicks on all goo.gl short URLs pointing to this long URL.

platforms.description: Top platforms or OSes, e.g. "Windows"; sorted by (descending) click counts. Only present if this data is available.

referrers.description: Top referring hosts, e.g. "www.google.com"; sorted by (descending) click counts. Only present if this data is available.

shortUrlClicks.description: Number of clicks on this short URL.

day.description: Click analytics over the last day.

month.description: Click analytics over the last month.

twoHours.description: Click analytics over the last two hours.

week.description: Click analytics over the last week.

count.description: Number of clicks for this top entry, e.g. for this particular country or browser.

id.description: Label assigned to this top entry, e.g. "US" or "Chrome".

analytics.description: A summary of the click analytics for the short and long URL. Might not be present if not requested or currently unavailable.

created.description: Time the short URL was created; ISO 8601 representation using the yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZZ format, e.g. "2010-10-14T19:01:24.944+00:00".

longUrl.description: Long URL, e.g. "http://www.google.com/". Might not be present if the status is "REMOVED".

status.description: Status of the target URL. Possible values: "OK", "MALWARE", "PHISHING", or "REMOVED". A URL might be marked "REMOVED" if it was flagged as spam, for example.

itemsPerPage.description: Number of items returned with each full "page" of results. Note that the last page could have fewer items than the "itemsPerPage" value.

nextPageToken.description: A token to provide to get the next page of results.

totalItems.description: Total number of short URLs associated with this user (may be approximate).

actions.description: Exchange the code passed to your redirect URI for an access_token
Exchange a refresh_token for an access_token

actions.title: url.get
actions.description: Expands a short URL or gets creation time and analytics.

shortUrl.description: The short URL, including the protocol.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

actions.title: url.list
actions.description: Retrieves a list of URLs shortened by a user.

start-token.description: Token for requesting successive pages of results.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.
